column4: .... ahe.... can you boot to your partition in recovery mode at least?
oh, I am now using a live cd.
so I assume win7 is on sda0?
drop to a console... and go to say... / in the live-cd... and type -> sudo mount /dev/sda1 /mnt; sudo mount -o bind /proc /mnt/proc; sudo mount -o bind /dev /mnt/dev; sudo chroot /mnt; update-grub
the update-grub, will reconfigure/remake the grub.conf on that 'chroot'ed filesystem
that means you didn't mount /mnt yet :|
Weird, I did exactly what you told me to type :D
I assume this [ http://www.pastebin.com/m195a1f67 ] is ok, Typos_King?
the mount directory/point is not relevant, doesn't have to be /mnt, just have to be consistent across the lines
